meanings.definition: Things that exist or are used or enjoyed for only a short time.
meanings.sent1: The beautiful flowers in the garden were ephemeras, blooming for just a few days.
meanings.sent2: She collected old tickets and brochures, considering them ephemeras due to their temporary nature.
meanings.sent3: The fleeting joy of blowing bubbles can be seen as ephemeras, disappearing as quickly as they are created.
meanings.sent4: Like a shooting star in the night sky, childhood is an ephemeras moment that fades too soon.
meanings.sent5: The melting ice cream cone served as a perfect example of something ephemeras, lasting only a few moments before dripping away.

meanings.definition: Items, especially printed material, that are meant to be discarded after use.
meanings.sent1: The event organizer handed out ephemeras like flyers and pamphlets to promote the concert.
meanings.sent2: After the conference, attendees left behind various ephemeras such as name tags and schedules.
meanings.sent3: The stack of disposable napkins and paper cups can be considered ephemeras at a picnic.
meanings.sent4: The newspaper from yesterday became an ephemeras reminder of the past once the new edition was out.
meanings.sent5: The library had a section dedicated to ephemeras like postcards and posters, showcasing different eras of history.
